name: Tiny Troops, Big Hearts
title: Smallest Armed Forces
description: With just 180 personnel in 2016, Antigua and Barbuda boasts one of the smallest military forces globally, reflecting its peaceful stance.

name: Eco-Friendly Nation
title: Minimal Methane Emissions
description: In 2023, Antigua and Barbuda's methane emissions from buildings were a mere 0.0001 Mt CO2e, showcasing its commitment to a sustainable environment.

name: Thirsty for More
title: Limited Freshwater Withdrawals
description: The country withdrew only 0.0044 billion cubic meters of freshwater in 2021, indicating a need for better water resource management.

name: Aid Dependency
title: High Technical Cooperation Grants
description: In 2021, Antigua and Barbuda received $530,000 in technical cooperation grants, highlighting its reliance on external aid for development.

name: Creative Spark
title: Minimal Industrial Design Applications
description: With only 1 industrial design application in 2021, there's potential for growth in innovation and creativity.

name: Classroom Comfort
title: Low Pupil-Teacher Ratio
description: In 2015, the pupil-teacher ratio in upper secondary education was just 3.71, ensuring personalized attention for students.

name: Healthy Youth
title: Minimal Child Mortality
description: In 2023, only 1 death was recorded among children aged 5-9, reflecting strong healthcare measures for young ones.

name: Cereal Scarcity
title: Minimal Cereal Production
description: With only 5 hectares dedicated to cereal production in 2022, Antigua and Barbuda relies heavily on imports for staple foods.

name: Aid from Afar
title: Negative Net Bilateral Aid from the US
description: In 2021, the net bilateral aid flow from the US was -$40,000, indicating a repayment or reduction in aid received.

name: Global Health Support
title: Net Official Flows from WHO
description: In 2021, Antigua and Barbuda received $3,200 from WHO, supporting its healthcare initiatives.
